abstract: College admissions officers and administrators say growing number of high school students have been taking massive open online courses, or MOOCs, to bolster their applications; tuition-free courses, designed by colleges and universities across globe, were originally intended as college-level work.
lead_paragraph: Massive open online courses, or MOOCs, intended as college-level work for anyone, are popping up on college applications, a sign of curiosity and, possibly, résumé packing.

headline.main: How High Schoolers Spent Their Summer: Online, Taking More Courses
headline.print_headline: How They Spent Their Summer Vacation: Online, Taking More Courses

snippet: Massive open online courses, or MOOCs, intended as college-level work for anyone, are popping up on college applications, a sign of curiosity and, possibly, résumé packing.
